== Verizon Bluetooth dial-up networking ==
This information complements the more generic BluetoothDialup guide.

===== EVDO Configuration =====
This has been tested and worked on the EVDO network but not on the 1xRTT net. (See the 1x configuration below)

This file is <code>/etc/chatscripts/verizon</code>:
<pre>
ABORT 'NO CARRIER' ABORT 'ERROR' ABORT 'NO DIALTONE' ABORT 'BUSY' ABORT 'NO ANSWER'
'' ATZ
OK-AT-OKL3 ATDT#777
CONNECT \d\c
</pre>

The corresponding <code>/etc/ppp/peers/verizon</code> file looks like this (replace the XXX with your phone #):
<pre>
hide-password
/dev/rfcomm0
connect "/usr/sbin/chat -v -f /etc/chatscripts/verizon"
noauth
defaultroute
usepeerdns
connect-delay 10000
user "XXX-XXX-XXXX@vzw3g.com"
lock
lcp-echo-failure 4
lcp-echo-interval 65535

115200
</pre>

===== 1xRTT Configuration =====
The following configuration has been tested and worked on the 1xRTT but not EVDO.

This file is <code>/etc/ppp/peers/1x</code>:
<pre>
hide-password
/dev/rfcomm0
connect "/usr/sbin/chat -v -f /etc/chatscripts/1x"
noauth
defaultroute
usepeerdns
connect-delay 10000
user "qnc"
password "qnc"
lcp-echo-failure 4
lcp-echo-interval 65535s
115200
</pre>

This file is <code>/etc/chatscripts/1x</code>:
<pre>
ABORT 'NO CARRIER' ABORT 'ERROR' ABORT 'NO DIALTONE' ABORT 'BUSY' ABORT 'NO ANSWER'
'' AT$QCMDR=2 
OK-AT-OKL3 ATDT#777
CONNECT \d\c
</pre>
